results.title: Cockpit drill
results.brief_description: Racing driver David Mackay discusses good driving drill: comfortable position, rear vision, and exact knowledge of “controls” (lights, wipers, choke, etc). Observe the road laws, always allowing for changing weather and traffic conditions. Exercise care when parking - turn off ignition, brake securely, and lock the car.

results.title: Clerical work
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
This is a field of work with many opportunities: secretaries, optometrists, general clerks, receptionists, bank teller, enquiry clerk, accountant and section head. Shows that with machines performing the monotonous jobs, todays office work is concerned more with planning and people. Part of the “Is this your career?”series.

results.title: Clean waters
results.creator_credit: Raphael Wolff and Raphael G. Wolff Studios
results.brief_description: This film is a variation of another film of the same title (307748). It contains the same message, but different images, of the function of water in everyday life. Fish, game, livestock, and human beings must have clean water - polluted water brings death. Public health is endangered, recreational facilities are limited, the productivity of streams and lakes decreased, and property values fall disastrously when water is polluted or there is danger of pollution. “Clean Waters” gives a very interesting account of two American sewage treatment methods which prevent pollution of water.

results.title: Clean milk
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson and Great Britain. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: A film for dairy farmers, pointing out that simple precautions (such as ensuring that milk cans waiting for delivery to the factory are shaded), should be carried out by dairy farmers in their own interests. For if milk consumption does not reach the public in the best possible condition, the Government will be obliged to legislate in such a way that farmers will be forced to carry out these same precautions.

results.title: A Class for Tommy
results.brief_description: Story of the establishment of an experimental training class for mentally handicapped children. Purposes of the class are to determine if such children will progress more satisfactorily in elementary school if given special training at an early age; whether certain undesirable attitudes and reactions may be prevented by early enrolment in such a program; and to establish desirable behaviour patterns at an early age in order to allow the child a more nearly normal happy life.

results.title: The Class
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Huw Wheldon and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Monitor”.
A close-up of the work of a class in a drama school and of the methods used to train the aspiring actors and actresses. John Schlesinger’s command of the particular directing technique required is such that the film appears to have been made spontaneously during the forty minutes or so of the single class. In fact it needed a week’s shooting and a considerable amount of preparation in order to give this impression. The tutor (Harold Lang) uses the Mercy Speech from ‘The Merchant of Venice’ as a starting point in an improvisation by the students. Originally made for the BBC Television program ‘Monitor’, it is exciting to watch a production in the hands of a dedicated artist.

group_siblings.title: East meets West
group_siblings.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton and BBC-TV

results.title: City water supply
results.brief_description: Illustrates the relation between rainfall and life. The sources of a city’s water supply - wells, rivers, lakes and watersheds - are also illustrated and the film goes on to study both the varied methods which are employed to distribute water throughout a city, and the methods used to prevent the spread of disease and epidemics through water-borne bacteria.

results.title: City limits
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Forthright, critical analysis of the problems of North American cities by Jane Jacobs, authority and author of books and articles on the subject. A former New Yorker, she chose to live in Toronto because “it is a city that still has options…it hasn’t made so many mistakes that it’s bound to go downhill.” Her remarks, and what this film shows, will interest all civic and community groups - in fact, all urban dwellers. Photography by Jacques Fogel, Albert Kish, Cameron Gaul, Raymond Dumas.
